intro: Hieraciodes kochiana, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its delicate appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
